channel.title: How about David Eddings?
channel.description: Does anyone read/know his books? Personally i've read all of The Belgariad, The Mallorean and the books about Elenia (not sure what the english name is) about 3 times. Basically they revolve around worlds full of conflict, politics, and they he writes it, it contains a good deal of humour. Personally i think it's my second favourite author of all times, only to be beaten by Terry Pratchett.

item.title: How about David Eddings?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Does anyone read/know his books? Personally i’ve read all of The Belgariad, The Mallorean and the books about Elenia (not sure what the english name is) about 3 times. Basically they revolve around worlds full of conflict, politics, and they he writes it, it contains a good deal of humour. Personally i think it’s my second favourite author of all times, only to be beaten by Terry Pratchett.
